Your email made a difference.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Thank you for sending a message to the Hoover Police Department to urge them to release their use-of-force and other policies. Your email made a difference because after just one day of hearing from advocates like you, they contacted our office to tell us they would comply with our records request. We received their use-of-force and body cam policies, and today, we released them to the public with our analysis so that all community members can be aware of their police department's policies, and so that we can advocate for reform of those policies when they are deficient or outdated. Learn more about police policies database.

However, even though they complied with our request to release their policies, they refused to release the video footage and name of the officer responsible for E.J. Bradford's death. Today, we joined with the Bradford family and Alabama NAACP to sue the Alabama Attorney General and Hoover Police Department to release this information. E.J.'s family and the people of Alabama deserve transparency and accountability from the police department responsible for the death of an innocent Black man. Learn more about Bradford, et Av v. Marshall, Derzis.

Together, we must hold government — including law enforcement — accountable. Thank you for doing your part.

Thanks for sticking with us,

ACLU of Alabama
